dataList.content: Flowers wilt, petals fall, a drizzle of blossoms sky-blotting;
Colors fade, fragrance dies—but who shall mourn their passing?
To the garden I go, in hand a flower-rake,
Only to pace, lest crushed the scatter'd blossoms I make.
Thus, in this troubled world I breathe,
To shut my eyes
Is my sole reprieve.
Little Baoyu. You must have walked and toiled tirelessly on your journey home.
I wouldn’t say I suffered much, grandmother. My days were always filled with new and interesting things to see.
Ugh… What are they talking about over there?
They’re sitting so far apart that I can hardly hear them. I mean, is this even a dining ‘table’? I can’t even see who’s sitting at the other end from here.
Is there anything bothering you, dear guests? If this humble servant can help with any—
Oh, there’s somethin’ bothering me alright. We’re in the middle of a meal, can you please stop—
Noooope! Nope, not at all! Nothing’s bothering us at all…! Everything’s good.
Now… Baoyu, my boy. When will you introduce me to your new friends?
… Oh, boy. I never know how to act in front of others' parents… Where should I look? Is… this an appropriate size for a polite smile? I hope I don’t come off too smarmy—
Ha ha, it's nothing to fuss over. Think of this as your own place, and enjoy your time here~
Woohoo~ Thank ya!
… But whew, this place is soooo huge that I can hardly relax. I’m worried I might get lost going out for a cup of water.

Ah, don't you worry~ We have stray people shelters located all around the house for that. Our servants visit them once a month to collect anyone who’s unfortunately gotten lost. If they’re still alive, that is~
Ha ha… Hong Lu, that has to be the funniest jo...ke you’ve ever told, ha ha ha...
Ha ha, I wasn’t joking, but I’m glad you enjoyed it anyway~
I must ask, Hong Lu, for I spy no other sibling of yours here; this is quite odd, for I had thought this to be a welcoming party for your return...

dataList.title: Jia Family
dataList.content: Hey, it’s my welcoming party, too.

dataList.title: Jia Family
dataList.content: Besides, what makes you think we’d ever want to see their stupid faces? Just to get mad?

dataList.title: Jia Family
dataList.content: It’s been like ten whole years since we even shared a meal together.

dataList.title: Jia Family
dataList.content: Oh, and… don’t even think about trying to chat me up. Did you already forget what I said earlier? There is nothing between us anymore. We're enemies.
Uh… did we initiate the conversation, though?
Oh, I am simply so glad that my son, Baoyu...
… has returned as a man who can now more than carry his own weight... And unharmed, too...
So, dear Baoyu…
I don’t mean to rush, but… when are you planning to depart again?
Nothing has been decided yet, mother.
I see… I-I am simply concerned that, were your stay here to be prolonged, perhaps you might fade before your duties are completed.
D-do you not also agree, venerable Jia Mu?
Indeed.
Dear Baoyu, our peerless treasure, tarry not overlong in this mundane world; leave when the time is right, and fulfill your worth.
Okay, grandmother. Mother.
Throughout the entire familial discussion, Hong Lu's expression remained the same, in that tranquil, perpetual smile.
Despite his return after years of wandering being met with the family's obvious push to make him leave as soon as possible...
... he stands unaffected, as though he were expecting this gaudy yet hollow welcome.
With his attitude being so passive, I also had no choice but to watch as a bystander.
A few hours ago...
... The palanquin'll be here soon.
... A p-palanquin?! Woahh~ So cool! That sure sounds like a fancy ride! Isn’t that just super, Greg?!
Ooh! Yeah, Saude! Are we getting a palanquin or whatever it's called to give us a ride all the way to the m-mansion?!
The usual comedy pair’s desperate efforts to lighten the mood are particularly appreciated today, as tragically ineffective as they seem to be.
Yes. The LCB and Jia Xichun will be heading to <ruby=Grand View Garden>Daguanyuan</ruby> where one of the most prominent families of H Corp. reside.
<If they’ve sent a whole palanquin to pick us up… huh, does Hong Lu’s family already know that he’ll be participating in the Family Hierarch war?>

No, it is unlikely that they are aware. After all, it can be assumed that the most likely reason that the company waited until the last minute to relay us this order was to minimize the chance of information leakage.
Therefore, it would be correct to presume that the palanquin is here merely as a gesture of welcome for Hong Lu and Jia Xichun's return.
Which means that only the invited—Hong Lu, Jia Xichun, and their ‘factions’ can ride the palanquin to Daguanyuan.
Unfortunately, this means the LCCB, Vergilius, and Charon won’t be able to join you on this journey.
That’s too bad. It would’ve been nice if we could all go there together.

dataList.title: Jia Family
dataList.content: … Just as petty as I expected from the seniors of our family. Would it kill them to house a handful more people in that humongous park of a house? It’s not like they’d notice the difference.
Oh my, how touching. Looks like miss Jia Xichun thinks she’ll miss us too.

dataList.title: Jia Family
dataList.content: What a thing to say to my face after that shameless backstabbing.
Ahaha...

dataList.title: Jia Family
dataList.content: I mean, do any of you even comprehend what it means to participate in the Family Hierarch war?

dataList.title: Jia Family
dataList.content: Do you even understand why we call it a ‘war’ when the official name for it is an ‘evaluation’?

dataList.title: Jia Family
dataList.content: You’re risking your lives by getting involved in this. Once you get in there, you'll be stalked at every turn by people looking to kill you.

dataList.title: Jia Family
dataList.content: Including me.

dataList.title: Jia Family
dataList.content: Remember how Wei saved your life back at that fake kezhan? Now imagine the same scenario, except this time, it could be Wei who's there to kill you.

dataList.title: Xichun's Clan
dataList.content: I must say ahead of time that this is a truly regrettable turn of events. I did not wish to have to fight any of you, but…
Wei looked at us with an unfamiliar and cold, intense glare.
W-well, we feel… very much the same way, so… Looks like we’re on the same page there… ha… ha ha...

dataList.title: Jia Family
dataList.content: This means that I'm also fair game. You could stab me in the back again, literally, this time.
Uh… no, never. I wouldn't even dream of doing something like—
Jia Xichun ignored Sinclair’s anxious pleas and looked straight toward Hong Lu.

dataList.title: Jia Family
dataList.content: This... could be the last chance to change your mind, brother.

dataList.title: Jia Family
dataList.content: I didn’t invite you to join my faction with a light heart.

dataList.title: Jia Family
dataList.content: Besides, it’s the Family Hierarch war. This isn’t something you can just flippantly decide that you wanna particip—
I know the life you've lived, Xichun.
I also grew up hearing those countless tales about the Family Hierarch war, just as you did.
So the weight we’re feeling must be the same.

dataList.title: Jia Family
dataList.content: Right. So this is where our tenuous alliance really ends.

dataList.title: Jia Family
dataList.content: Well, not like I care. It did drag on a little too long for a temporary alliance forged out of convenience.

dataList.title: Jia Family
dataList.content: … We’re just going back to how things used to be, that's all.

dataList.title: Jia Family
dataList.content: And that's fine by me. I think that's enough chit-chat with you, then.
Okay. If that's what you want.
... Oh, Xichun.

dataList.title: Jia Family
dataList.content: ... What.
... Please don't tell the family that I'll be participating, will you?
I was told to keep this a secret for now.

dataList.title: Jia Family
dataList.content: ... Hah.

dataList.title: Jia Family
dataList.content: Tell me one reason I should do you that favor now.
For someone who supposedly doesn’t care, Xichun appeared rather hurt as she took a moment to glare at Hong Lu, biting her lower lip…
... then suddenly strode right up to him.

dataList.title: Jia Family
dataList.content: Is this even your call, brother?

dataList.title: Jia Family
dataList.content: Or are you just following their orders?
Jia Xichun gestured toward the rest of us with her chin.
Mm... my participation in the Family Hierarch war is already decided. If you're still curious to know why, then...
Xichun, do you believe that my choices carry any significant meaning?

dataList.title: Jia Family
dataList.content: … Oh, I see what's up. This crap again.

dataList.title: Jia Family
dataList.content: So you already know what participating in the war means, but you just have no idea why I'd ever ask you something like that, huh?

dataList.title: Jia Family
dataList.content: Fine, looks like I don't even need to hear your reply. There’s no point in trying with you anymore.

dataList.title: Jia Family
dataList.content: At least I’ll have fun watching how far you get with that shallow, meaningless attitude of yours.
<Hey, wait…>
Jia Xichun appeared pretty distressed after that exchange, so I was about to say something—when Pilot, who had been fiddling with the radio behind Saude, began shouting urgently.
Woah! Manager Saude! A palanquin's been seen coming this way!
Ugh… I’d like to chill a bit today, yesterday was too tough. Let’s head on over so we can at least relax on the way there—

dataList.title: Jia Family
dataList.content: Nope, we’re taking this one.

dataList.title: Jia Family
dataList.content: You never think twice about giving things up to others anyway, do you, brother?
Huh? What the heck do ya mean? C’mon, let’s do this fair and square with, like, uh… rock, paper, and scissors?

dataList.title: Jia Family
dataList.content: Wooow, sure. Why not decide the next Hierarch with a game of rock, paper, and scissors, too? How’s that?
Jia Xichun gave us a wry grin before leaving. Wei followed her wordlessly.
Boy… and I thought we were finally making some friends out here.
Look! Over there, there's a group waiting for a palanquin! One of ‘em must be the candidate the client told us about!
E-everyone, there's a group of hostile-looking people coming our way...
Shi Yihua is unlikely to be the only one who's going after the other candidates… Executive Manager, we best take care of them before the next palanquin arrives.
<… Yeah. What can we do, right?>
